summary: Vivian L. McPherson was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears in multiple payroll certifications and payroll records from the HSCA. These documents span from October 1976 to December 1977 and June 1978, indicating her employment with the committee during that period. The documents list her name, and in some cases, her position, annual salary, and pay period earnings. Social Security Numbers have been redacted to protect personal privacy.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Vivian L. McPherson's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify her role within the committee, her presence on the payroll indicates she contributed to the HSCA's operations during its investigation.
